newsitem.title: USA: Exide sees Q2 debt-related charge.
newsitem.headline: Exide sees Q2 debt-related charge.

text.p: Exide Electronics Group Inc said on Monday it will post a charge of $2.0 million for the second quarter ended March 31, 1997 after it restructures its credit facility.

The company's new $170 million senior credit facility, arranged by J.P. Morgan Securities and NationsBanc Capital Markets, will replace a $175 million senor credit facility that was used to help its acquisition of Deltec Power Systems last year, Exide said. Writing off the old debt costs will leade to a one-time tax benefit and interest savings that could improve earnings per share annually by $0.10, Exide said.
Exide said it also expects second quarter sales at the low end of a range of $140 million to $145 million with a stronger U.S. dollar hurting European revenues.
Revenues in last year's second quarter totaled $101.7 million.

For the year ending September 1997, the company expects total revenues to be in the $580 million to $590 million range with earnings before interest taxes depreciation and amortization margin in excess of 11 percent for the year, Exide said.
Exide said it had approximately $105 million oustanding under the old credit facility.
The new five year credit facility includes a revolving loand and a term loan, while providing anticpated interest savings of approximately 100 basis points compared to the old facility, Exide said.
